author: Rutherforde Sandy, Chicago Marketing Examiner
title: Top 10 DIY Wedding Ideas
text:
Top 10 DIY Wedding Ideas Use your key for the next article Comment 
So you are in the throws of planning your big day, and trying to make decisions about what to buy and what to make. Are you the crafty type, just waiting to sink your teeth into the DIY heaven that is planning your wedding? Or do you find yourself intimidated by the world of Pinterest and all of its step-by-step ideas? Well whatever your craft aptitude, here are 10 DIY wedding ideas that you’ll want to think about trying for your wedding. 
Hand-painted wooden signs are showing up in all forms of decorating. In the world of DIY wedding ideas , painted signs can be used to direct wedding guests to their seat and to the receptions and are even being used in wedding and engagement photos. With wood in all different shapes and sizes and hardware stores like Home Depot and Lowes to cut them for you, the options for a crafty bride are limitless. 
A beautiful reception table usually has an eye-catching centerpiece. From topiaries, to candles to a centerpiece of separate yet perfectly placed knick-knacks, there are so many ways to pull together the table. Take time to think about your colors or even the season in which you are getting married and go from there. 
Printable favor tags can easily be found with sites like Etsy or can be made by a computer savvy bride. Pair a cute vintage tag with some brown package string and give your wedding favors the wow factor. This DIY wedding idea can add that extra touch to your place settings at the reception. 
Ribbons are everywhere these days. You’ve probably seen them on the backs of chairs at receptions and used as the backdrop for wedding booth photos. Grab a color scheme and a pair of scissors and start cutting lengths of ribbon. Dainty and elegant, ribbon brings a mix of elegance and eclectic to your day. 
Decorate your own cupcake. Food bars are not going anywhere and while making some variations on your own is not feasible while also planning to have time to wear a white dress and walk down the aisle, a cup cake bar is the perfect DIY wedding idea. Cupcakes can be baked in advance and frozen. Additionally, frostings and toppings can be prepped so that all you need is to have a close friend set up the station while you are getting ready. 
Having an outdoor wedding? Put your wedding program on a fan. This DIY is the perfect mix of form and function. Rather than asking your guests to juggle both a fan and the wedding program, you have taken care of both in one grand swoop. Your guests will appreciate you stream lining your handouts and will further be grateful for a fan to cool off during your vow exchange. 
You can do a DIY wedding photo booth, if you plan well ahead. With access to an iPad, a printer, a hashtag and some fun props, it is not necessary to spend thousands of dollars for your guests to get their picture keepsake. Plus, a homemade photo booth will allow you to infuse more of your personality into the day. It might be a good idea to assign a tech savvy friend to man the photo booth or make it even simpler by providing the props, backdrop and a sign encouraging your guests to take their own photos with their phones and cameras. 
Craft a flower crown. For a more Bohemian look, flower crowns are always popular. With a little searching on the Internet and some practice, you can design your own alternative to the classic veil. 
Design your own invitations. It is not necessary to spend the bulk of your budget on your invitations these days. With computer programs, internet help and even Etsy, you can design a lower cost invitation and have them printed at the local print shop or even at your house. 
Design a fun guestbook alternative. The classic guestbook is quickly becoming a thing of the past and couples are finding new and creative ways to have their guests check in. From thumbprints to marriage advice, the guestbook alternative is a DIY wedding idea that will allow you to really stretch your creativity. Take some time to think about what you want to remember about your wedding and the guests. Whatever it is you are seeking, try to find a fun and creative way to incorporate a new spin on an old guestbook. 
Weddings can be expensive. In order to reel in your budget and infuse some creativity into your big day, choose a few DIY Wedding ideas to incorporate. You and your guests will love the extra special touches.
